sections.text: The Princeton School of Public and International Affairs offers the MPA to prepare students for leadership in public service, combining rigorous social science training with a focus on real-world policy impact.

items: Core courses in economics, politics, and quantitative methods
Policy workshops addressing real client problems
sections.text: The two-year program features core courses in economics, politics, and quantitative methods, plus policy workshops and electives across the University.

items: Previous public policy or related experience recommended
sections.text: Applicants are expected to demonstrate public service motivation, leadership, and quantitative readiness.
Graduates hold leadership positions in government, international organizations, nonprofits, and academia worldwide.
